thread.title: Jetstar adds Wellington to Dunedin flights
thread.title_full: Jetstar adds Wellington to Dunedin flights

title: Jetstar adds Wellington to Dunedin flights
text:
Jetstar adds Wellington to Dunedin flights 
  12:35 p.m. 
By 3 News online staff 
Jetstar is expanding its New Zealand network, adding a Wellington to Dunedin flight. 
The service will run three times a week from October 28 and is expected to add 56,000 seats to Wellington's domestic market. 
Jetstar's New Zealand head Grant Kerr says customers have regularly requested the route. 
"We're looking forward to linking the two cities and offering students, leisure and business travellers a low-fares option for airline travel," he says. 
The services will leave Wellington on Wednesday, Friday and Sunday at 11:10am, with a return service leaving Dunedin at 12:55pm. 
Wellington Airport chief executive Steve Sanderson says the additional Jetstar route will be "hugely beneficial" for New Zealand. 
To mark the launch, special one-way fares will be available until 4pm today from $29, for travel between February 3 and March 16 next year, and $49 for flights between October 28 and December 9 this year. 
Jetstar also announced today it will be adding its wide-body Boeing 787 to its trans-Tasman schedule over the upcoming Christmas season, along with extra flights between Australia, Queenstown and Christchurch. 
The service will run on Monday between Melbourne and Auckland and Auckland to Sydney for seven weeks from the middle of December to the end of January. 
Additional Airbus A320 capacity from Australia to Queenstown has also been added for the busy holiday season, with more than 10,000 extra seats between December and January compared with last year. 
3 News
